promise: End welfare as we know it" and require recipients to work or prepare for work.
evidence: Personal Responsibility and Work Opportunity Reconciliation Act of 1996 (H.R.3734)

promise: Cut the budget deficit in half in four years
evidence: Omnibus Budget Reconciliation Act of 1993 (H.R.2264)

promise: Promote and ratify the North American Free Trade Agreement (NAFTA)
evidence: North American Free Trade Agreement Implementation Act (H.R.3450)

promise: Raise the federal minimum wage
evidence: Small Business Job Protection Act of 1996 (H.R.3448)

promise: Create a national civilian service program (AmeriCorps)
evidence: National and Community Service Trust Act of 1993 (H.R.2010)

promise: Reform national education standards with mandatory testing and accountability (No Child Left Behind).
evidence: No Child Left Behind Act of 2001
Public Law No: 107-110
H.R. 1 (107th Congress)

promise: Provide tax cuts for all taxpayers.
evidence: Economic Growth and Tax Relief Reconciliation Act of 2001 (EGTRRA)
H.R. 1836 (107th Congress)

promise: Increase domestic energy production, including drilling in the Arctic National Wildlife Refuge (ANWR).
evidence: H.R. 4 (Energy Policy Act of 2003)

promise: Reduce the role of U.S. troops as "nation-builders" abroad.
evidence: White House National Security Strategy, 2002

promise: Create a prescription drug benefit for seniors under Medicare.
evidence: Medicare Prescription Drug, Improvement, and Modernization Act of 2003
H.R. 1 (108th Congress)

promise: Sign a universal health care bill into law by the end of his first term
evidence: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (H.R. 3590), signed into law 2010-03-23

affectedIndustries.name: Healthcare Providers
affectedIndustries.reasoning: Increased insured population but also new regulations and reimbursement models.

affectedIndustries.name: Health Insurance
affectedIndustries.reasoning: Fundamental reshaping of the health insurance market with new mandates, exchanges, and consumer protections.

affectedIndustries.name: Pharmaceutical
affectedIndustries.reasoning: Expanded patient access to medication but also increased scrutiny on drug pricing.

promise: Seek verifiable reductions in U.S. and Russian nuclear stockpiles
evidence: New START Treaty (ratified by U.S. Senate 2010-12-22; entered into force 2011-02-05)

affectedIndustries.name: Defense Contracting
affectedIndustries.reasoning: Reductions in stockpiles could shift spending priorities, potentially affecting demand for certain weapons systems or maintenance contracts.

affectedIndustries.name: Nuclear Weapons Manufacturing
affectedIndustries.reasoning: Focus on reductions implies less emphasis on production or expansion of nuclear arsenals.

promise: Reform mandatory minimum sentences for non-violent drug offenders
evidence: Fair Sentencing Act of 2010 (S. 1789), signed into law 2010-08-03, reduced sentencing disparities for crack vs. powder cocaine

affectedIndustries.name: Private Prison Operators
affectedIndustries.reasoning: Reduced sentences could lead to fewer inmates, potentially decreasing demand for private prison services and government contracts.

affectedIndustries.name: Legal Services
affectedIndustries.reasoning: Changes in sentencing laws alter legal defense strategies and caseloads, potentially shifting the nature of demand for legal professionals.

affectedIndustries.name: Rehabilitation Services
affectedIndustries.reasoning: Emphasis on reform and reduced incarceration might increase demand for community-based rehabilitation and support services.

promise: Enact new regulations on the financial sector (prevent future financial crises)
evidence: Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act (H.R. 4173), signed into law 2010-07-21

affectedIndustries.name: Financial Services
affectedIndustries.reasoning: Dodd-Frank imposed significant new regulations, increasing compliance costs and altering business models across banking, investment, and insurance sectors.

affectedIndustries.name: Banking
affectedIndustries.reasoning: New capital requirements, stress tests, and consumer protection mandates directly impacted bank operations, risk management, and profitability.

affectedIndustries.name: Investment Management
affectedIndustries.reasoning: Regulations on derivatives, hedge funds, and securitization altered trading practices and product offerings.

promise: Centralize ethics and lobbying information for voters
evidence: Launch of ethics.gov transparency website in 2012, aggregating ethics, lobbying, and campaign finance data from multiple agencies

affectedIndustries.name: Lobbying
affectedIndustries.reasoning: Increased transparency requirements and public scrutiny could alter strategies and demand for lobbying services.

affectedIndustries.name: Public Relations
affectedIndustries.reasoning: Increased public access to ethics and lobbying data might influence corporate communications and public relations strategies.

affectedIndustries.name: Data Analytics/Compliance
affectedIndustries.reasoning: The creation and maintenance of a central transparency portal could create demand for related data management and compliance software/services.

promise: I will build a great great wall on our southern border and I'll have Mexico pay for that wall.
evidence: Executive Order 13767 signed on 2017-01-25 directing wall construction
Partial appropriations by Congress (see H.J.Res. 31, 2019)
No mechanism made Mexico pay.

affectedIndustries.name: Construction
affectedIndustries.reasoning: Increased demand for construction materials and labor for border barrier projects.

affectedIndustries.name: Security and Border Control
affectedIndustries.reasoning: Increased government contracts for surveillance, security technology, and personnel related to border enforcement.

promise: Real change begins with immediately repealing and replacing the disaster known as Obamacare.
evidence: American Health Care Act of 2017 (H.R. 1628) failed in the Senate on 2017-07-28.

affectedIndustries.name: Healthcare Providers (Hospitals, Doctors)
affectedIndustries.reasoning: Repeal efforts created uncertainty; potential for fewer insured patients but also less regulation. Ultimate failure meant status quo largely prevailed.

affectedIndustries.name: Health Insurance
affectedIndustries.reasoning: Significant market uncertainty and debate around potential new regulatory frameworks, though existing ACA structure remained in place.

promise: Everybody is getting a tax cut, especially the middle class." / "The Trump Plan will lower the business tax rate from 35 percent to 15 percent...
evidence: H.R. 1 (Tax Cuts and Jobs Act), signed into law 2017-12-22.

affectedIndustries.name: Corporate Sector
affectedIndustries.reasoning: Direct reduction in corporate tax rates led to increased profits and capital available for investment.

affectedIndustries.name: Retail and Consumer Goods
affectedIndustries.reasoning: Individual tax cuts increased disposable income, potentially boosting consumer spending.

affectedIndustries.name: Financial Services
affectedIndustries.reasoning: Increased corporate profits and individual wealth could lead to more investment and financial activity.

promise: We’re getting out" of the Paris Agreement (on climate).
evidence: Official White House announcement and official U.S. notification to the United Nations.

affectedIndustries.name: Fossil Fuels (Coal, Oil & Gas)
affectedIndustries.reasoning: Reduced regulatory pressure and perceived support for domestic production without international climate commitments.

affectedIndustries.name: Renewable Energy
affectedIndustries.reasoning: Signaling less government emphasis on climate change mitigation could disincentivize investment and growth in renewable sectors.

promise: …countries in which immigration will be suspended would include places like Syria and Libya. And we are going to stop the tens of thousands of people coming in from Syria.
evidence: Executive Order 13769 (1/27/2017)
Revised by EO 13780 (3/6/2017)

affectedIndustries.name: Travel and Tourism
affectedIndustries.reasoning: Reduced international travel, particularly from affected regions, impacting airlines, hotels, and related services.

affectedIndustries.name: Higher Education
affectedIndustries.reasoning: Reduced enrollment of international students and researchers from affected countries due to visa restrictions and perceived unwelcoming environment.

promise: Enact a once-in-a-generation infrastructure investment (Bipartisan Infrastructure Law)
evidence: Bipartisan Infrastructure Law (Infrastructure Investment and Jobs Act, H.R. 3684, signed as Public Law No: 117-58)

affectedIndustries.name: Construction
affectedIndustries.reasoning: Direct investment in infrastructure projects like roads, bridges, and public transit drives demand for construction services and materials.

affectedIndustries.name: Manufacturing
affectedIndustries.reasoning: Increased demand for building materials, machinery, and components required for infrastructure projects.

affectedIndustries.name: Logistics & Transportation
affectedIndustries.reasoning: Improved and modernized infrastructure enhances efficiency and capacity for freight and passenger transport.

promise: Deliver the largest-ever federal investment in clean energy and climate action (Inflation Reduction Act)
evidence: Inflation Reduction Act (H.R. 5376, signed as Public Law No: 117-169)

affectedIndustries.name: Renewable Energy
affectedIndustries.reasoning: Significant tax credits, subsidies, and investments directly support solar, wind, and other clean energy technologies.

affectedIndustries.name: Automotive
affectedIndustries.reasoning: Incentives for electric vehicle (EV) purchases and manufacturing, and investment in EV charging infrastructure.

affectedIndustries.name: Energy Efficiency & Building Retrofits
affectedIndustries.reasoning: Provisions for energy efficiency upgrades in homes and commercial buildings, driving demand for related services and products.

promise: Restore and build upon the Affordable Care Act ("Obamacare")
evidence: Executive Order 14009 (EO 14009 – Strengthening Medicaid and the Affordable Care Act, signed 2021-01-28)
expanded subsidies passed as part of the American Rescue Plan (H.R. 1319)
extended in the Inflation Reduction Act (H.R. 5376)

affectedIndustries.name: Health Insurance
affectedIndustries.reasoning: Expanded subsidies and increased enrollment in ACA plans stabilize and potentially grow the customer base for health insurers.

affectedIndustries.name: Healthcare Providers
affectedIndustries.reasoning: More insured individuals can lead to higher utilization of healthcare services and reduced uncompensated care.

affectedIndustries.name: Pharmaceuticals
affectedIndustries.reasoning: While expanding coverage, subsequent policies (like drug price negotiation in the IRA) enacted alongside ACA strengthening could introduce revenue pressures.

promise: Return the U.S. to a global leadership role on climate by rejoining the Paris Agreement
evidence: Executive Order 14008 (EO 14008 – Tackling the Climate Crisis), rejoining Paris Agreement
U.S. formally rejoined on 2021-02-19 per U.N. Secretary-General

affectedIndustries.name: Renewable Energy
affectedIndustries.reasoning: Signals a strong governmental commitment to climate action, encouraging further investment and policy support for clean energy domestically and internationally.

affectedIndustries.name: Environmental Consulting & Technology
affectedIndustries.reasoning: Increased focus on climate goals can drive demand for expertise in emissions reduction, sustainability reporting, and climate adaptation technologies.

affectedIndustries.name: International Trade & Investment (Green Economy)
affectedIndustries.reasoning: Aligns the U.S. with global climate efforts, potentially fostering international cooperation and investment in green technologies and markets.

promise: Pursue comprehensive immigration reform with a path to citizenship for undocumented immigrants
evidence: U.S. Citizenship Act of 2021 (H.R. 1177); introduced 2021-02-18, not enacted as law

affectedIndustries.name: Legal Services
affectedIndustries.reasoning: If passed, comprehensive immigration reform would create significant demand for legal services related to citizenship applications and immigration processes.

affectedIndustries.name: Agriculture
affectedIndustries.reasoning: Comprehensive reform could stabilize the labor force and provide legal pathways for workers in sectors heavily reliant on immigrant labor, but its failure means ongoing uncertainty.

affectedIndustries.name: Construction
affectedIndustries.reasoning: Similar to agriculture, this sector relies on immigrant labor, and reform could address labor shortages and improve working conditions, but its failure leaves these issues unresolved.
